comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
For the Army-Navy game of 1913, held at New York's Polo Grounds:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4647768126/]

The game was held on November 29, 1913. Army sank the Navy, winning 22-9. President Woodrow Wilson, Commander in Chief of both branches of the service, was a spectator that day:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4605957835/]

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
Army's mascot: The mule's stubborn support for the team no doubt ensured Army's comfortable margin of victory:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4606572338/]

Navy's mascot was a smelly goat. Navy thought the final score was stinky, too.
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4606572166/]
